sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.chinese: 她说：“从来没觉得，我非常喜欢演戏，对于我来说，演戏给我很多快乐，而且永远这样做也是很酷的，一点也不觉得厌烦。”

sentences.chinese: 我姐姐玛戈特1926年出生在德国美因河畔的法兰克福。

sentences.chinese: 六年级结束的时候，我和科普卢斯夫人都流下了离别的眼泪，因为我被犹太公立中学录取了，而玛戈特也在那里读中学。

sentences.chinese: 一部针对青少年的性教育电视系列片

sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.chinese: 你为什么那么讨厌她？

sentences.chinese: 我对雷声甚至于轻微地震的厌恶都归因于我的母亲。

sentences.english: It's reasonable, I think, to invoke Dr. Johnson here, Samuel Johnson, who writes in his Life of Milton that Milton's unskillful allegory appears to be one of the greatest faults of the poem.

sentences.chinese: 许多雇主已经认识到年龄歧视是不公平的。

sentences.english: She won £20,000 for unfair dismissal(= being illegally made to leave your job ).
sentences.chinese: 她因被不公平解雇而得到两万英镑的赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: not right or fair, especially because not everyone has an equal opportunity

sentences.english: She turned to me for advice.
sentences.chinese: 她求教于我。

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

sentences.english: When you fail, you should never lose heart.
sentences.chinese: 当你失败时，你不应丧失信心。

sentences.english: When we meet with failure, we don't lose heart.
sentences.chinese: 当我们遇到困难时，不可丧失信心。

detailed_translations.english: to stop hoping for sth or trying to do sth because you no longer feel confident

sentences.english: Strangely, I miss the bus, a mobile Hogwarts on a good day with moments of magic; on a bad day like a prisoner transport heading for Robben Island.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是我很想念那辆巴士。 它是一座移动的魔法学校，在好日子里充满神奇的时光，在坏日子里车上的人们却像被押送到罗宾岛的囚犯。

sentences.english: Along with Nelson Mandela, Zuma was imprisoned on Robben Island for conspiring to overthrow white rule, spending 10 years in jail before going into exile in neighboring states.
sentences.chinese: 祖马因参与推翻白人统治，和曼德拉一道被囚禁于罗宾岛，在狱中被囚禁10年，随后被放逐到他国。

sentences.english: See Robben Island, then take a bus to Springbok.
sentences.chinese: 可看罗宾岛，然后坐巴士去斯普林博克。

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

sentences.english: She huddled herself in the blanket.
sentences.chinese: 她用毯子紧紧裹住自己。

sentences.english: They muffled up her head with a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他们用毯子蒙住了她的头。

sentences.english: He lapped his daughter in a warm blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他把女儿裹在一个暖和的毯子里。

detailed_translations.english: a cover for a bed, usually made of wool

sentences.english: The Ormerod School educates handicapped children.
sentences.chinese: 奥默罗德学校的教育对象为残疾儿童。

sentences.english: a campaign to educate teenagers about HIV
sentences.chinese: 教育青少年了解艾滋病病毒的运动

detailed_translations.english: to teach a child at a school, college, or university

sentences.english: a highly educated woman
sentences.chinese: 很有修养的女子

detailed_translations.english: having been well taught and learned a lot

sentences.english: On the other hand, a dismal leader could come to power in China and cause considerable damage to the economy.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，假如一个昏庸的领导人上台执政，就会给贵国经济带来严重损害。

sentences.english: She begged and pleaded with them until they finally agreed.
sentences.chinese: 她一再恳求，后来他们终于同意了。

sentences.english: She fought back the sudden urge to run to him and beg his forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她突然很想冲上去请求他原谅，但是她忍住了。

detailed_translations.english: to ask for something in an anxious or urgent way, because you want it very much

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: terror
trans: 恐怖；恐怖时期；恐怖活动

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

sentences.english: The children had suffered cruelty and neglect.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子遭受虐待，无人照管。

sentences.english: There was a hint of cruelty in Brian’s smile.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩的微笑里流露出一丝残暴。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: Transkei
trans: 特兰斯凯（南非东南部一地区）

sentences.english: Nelson Mandela was born in a small village in the Transkei region of South Africa. He eas born on 18th July, 1918.
sentences.chinese: 纳尔森·曼德拉1918年七月18日出生在南非特兰斯凯地区的一个小村庄。

sentences.english: The capital of Transkei, in the west-central part of the homeland. It was founded in1860 as a military post. Population, 30, 000.
sentences.chinese: 乌姆塔塔特兰斯凯首都，在“黑人家园”班图斯坦的中西部，做为一军事要塞建于1860年，人口30，000。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特兰斯凯（南非东南部一地区）

sentences.english: The two sides agreed to set up a commission to investigate claims.
sentences.chinese: 双方同意成立一个委员会，调查索赔问题。

sentences.english: ...an organization which sets up meetings about issues of interest to women.
sentences.chinese: …一个安排有关妇女利益问题的会议组织。

detailed_translations.english: If you set something up, you create or arrange it

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

sentences.english: In Kenya, which is considered one of the more Westernized nations in Africa, gay people can be sentenced to years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚被认为是在非洲西化得较多的一个国家，那里的同性恋依然会被判处数年的监禁。

sentences.english: ...antiaircraft guns.
sentences.chinese: ...防空炮。

sentences.english: ...antidiscrimination legislation.
sentences.chinese: ...反歧视立法。

sentences.english: ...anti-inflammatory drugs.
sentences.chinese: ...抗发炎药。

detailed_translations.english: Anti- is used to form adjectives and nouns that describe things that are intended to destroy something harmful or to prevent something from happening

sentences.english: Later, believing all mankind to be equal, he devoted himself to stopping the unfair anti-black laws.
sentences.chinese: 后来，因为相信所有人类都是生来平等，他全身心投入到废除不平等的反黑人法律工作中。

sentences.english: I travelled from Cairo to Cape Town in 2002.
sentences.chinese: 2002年，我从开罗一路旅行到了开普敦。

sentences.english: Given that Capello refused to back Green after the game, Hart should get his chance against Algeria in Cape Town on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 假定卡佩罗在赛后不支持格林，那哈特就有机会参加星期五开普敦与阿尔及利亚的比赛。

sentences.english: But their confidence never wavered as Blatter remarked during the team draw in Cape Town six months ago. "You are ready. I am ready.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们的信心从未动摇，布拉特六个月前在开普敦小组抽签时重申：“你们准备好了，我准备好了。

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

sentences.english: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
sentences.chinese: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

detailed_translations.english: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject
